prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three koots:
1. green bell pepper
2. red bell pepper
3. yellow bell pepper

Now pick out the other koots from the following list:
1. box truck
2. red bell pepper
3. bee
4. crane
5. bear
6. onion
7. seal
8. yellow bell pepper
9. cat
10. green bell pepper
11. basset hound
12. full-trailer truck
13. carrot
14. pumpkin
15. chiller truck
16. eggplant
17. Labrador
18. school bus
19. loader
20. Dalmatian
21. car


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. toucan and garbage truck
2. yellow bell pepper and pumpkin
3. eggplant and green bell pepper
4. seal and green bell pepper
5. potato and full-trailer truck
6. pig and crane
7. green bell pepper and cat
8. tractor and school bus
9. red bell pepper and box truck
10. bee and seal
11. bee and Dalmatian
12. pig and mutt
13. yellow bell pepper and toucan
14. yellow bell pepper and green bell pepper
15. full-trailer truck and garbage truck
16. motorcycle and bear
17. car and eggplant
18. terrier and garbage truck
19. seal and crane
20. full-trailer truck and bear
21. seal and school bus
22. crane and school bus
23. terrier and green bell pepper
24. car and Dalmatian
25. motorcycle and loader
26. green bell pepper and mutt
27. car and terrier
28. potato and school bus
29. loader and mutt
30. semi-trailer truck and school bus
31. terrier and Labrador
32. red bell pepper and tractor
33. tractor and loader
34. eggplant and bee
35. pig and chiller truck
36. terrier and basset hound
37. cat and bear
38. bee and Labrador
39. full-trailer truck and semi-trailer truck
40. pumpkin and basset hound
41. tractor and crane
42. potato and mutt
43. tractor and pumpkin
44. bee and school bus
45. green bell pepper and pig
46. red bell pepper and carrot
47. carrot and basset hound
48. red bell pepper and pumpkin
49. full-trailer truck and motorcycle
50. carrot and crane


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
